questions.question: At an undirected intersection between a national road and county, municipal or local road, the right of way is granted to:

options.text: Vehicles traveling on the county, municipal or local road
Traffic coming from the right
Vehicles circulating on the national road.

questions.question: When leaving a residential or pedestrian area, you are forced to give way to:

options.text: Cars
Pedestrians coming from the opposite direction
All the vehicles you intersect.

questions.question: At which indicator does the driver lose priority?

options.text: Priority for traffic from the opposite direction
Priority for your direction
When meeting the indicator ‘Road with priority’.

questions.question: Which of the three vehicles will pass through the intersection last?

options.text: Car
Truck
motorcycle.

questions.question: What will you do on meeting the indicator and this panel?

options.text: Stop, ensure and give way to all vehicles
Give way only to vehicles driving from the left
Give way only to public transport vehicles.

questions.question: What does a driver do, when exiting a yard or garage onto a public road?

options.text: Give way to pedestrians and vehicles that are in motion
Request to be guided by another person
Uses the horn during the day and light signals at night.

questions.question: On a priority road, the driver at the intersection sees a pedestrian marking. Is he obliged to give way?

options.text: Yes, to pedestrians crossing the road in his driving direction
No, because he is driving on a priority road
Yes, both to pedestrians and vehicles approaching from the opposite direction and those who change the direction of travel to the left.

questions.question: What is order in which vehicles move through the intersection?

options.text: Trolleybus, tram, car
Tram car, trolley
Tram, trolleybus, car.

questions.question: Which vehicles have the right of way?

options.text: Bus and motorcycle
Motorcycle and truck
Bus and car.

questions.question: What is the order in which vehicles pass through the intersection?

options.text: Tram, bike, car
Bike, car, tram
Bike, tram, car.

questions.question: A driver is forced to give way at an undirected intersection if:

options.text: Entering a county road, from a national road
Entering a national road, from a county, local or municipal road
Entering a secondary or local road, from a county road.

questions.question: When leaving a location with your vehicle, you will have:

options.text: To avoid excessively forcing the engine
To avoid jerking the vehicle controls
To give way to vehicles traveling on the road, regardless of the direction of travel.

questions.question: When governmental priority vehicles pass, with their warning sirens and flashing blue lights, you must:

options.text: Reduce speed
Ride as close to the margin of the road in the direction of travel
Give way.

questions.question: What obligations does a driver have, when entering or leaving a row of stationed (parked) vehicles?

options.text: To ensure that the distance between vehicles is sufficient for parking.
To signal and ensure that the maneuver can be performed
Not to perform the maneuver in the action area of the indicator “Stationing prohibited”.

questions.question: Which of the three vehicle passes through the intersection last?

options.text: Motorcycle
Car
Tram.

questions.question: In the first intersection you will give way:

options.text: To vehicles coming from the right, if there no other regulations in the intersection
To vehicles coming from the left
To all vehicles coming from the left or right.

questions.question: Specify the situations where vehicles listed below have the right of way (priority to pass):

options.text: Vehicles already in the roundabout, over those who are preparing to enter the roundabout
Public transport vehicles, which have begun moving from a station.
Vehicles executing a U-turn (turning maneuver).

questions.question: In this situation, you should you give way to:

options.text: Vehicles traveling on the transversal road
Vehicles who come from the left side
No vehicle.

questions.question: What are your obligations when you see pedestrian crossings in your direction of travel?

options.text: Give way to pedestrians crossing from the other direction of travel as well
Reduce speed and slip through the pedestrians
Give way to pedestrians who are crossing the pedestrian crossing toward your direction.

questions.question: What do you do in the following intersection?

options.text: Cross without giving way
Cross after granting priority to the right
Cross after granting priority to the left.

questions.question: What is the sequence in which the three vehicles pass through the intersection?

options.text: car, blue car, bus
Blue car, red car, bus
Bus, blue car, red car.

questions.question: What will you do in this case?

options.text: Accelerate to pass in front of the pedestrians
Horn so that pedestrians do not engage in crossing
Stop, to allow pedestrians to cross.

questions.question: What do you do in this situation?

options.text: Brake in advance to give way to pedestrians, who are crossing
Cross the street fast
Cross the pedestrian crossing before they do.

questions.question: Who has priority on the narrow road?

options.text: The car, as it circulates on the right side of the bus
bus, as it is not changing its direction of travel
The car, because it travels at a higher speed.

questions.question: Which of the two vehicles will enter the intersection first?

options.text: The motorcycle, as it moves more quickly
The motorcycle, as it moves forward
The car, as it travels on a priority road.

questions.question: What priority rule applies at undirected intersections outside towns?

options.text: Priority for the vehicle with higher speed
Priority for the main road
Right priority.

questions.question: What are your obligations under the circumstances?

options.text: To grant priority to pedestrians
To horn, to warn pedestrians
To drive with caution, as the indicator pre-signals a pedestrian crossing.

questions.question: What is the sequence in which vehicles move through the intersection?

options.text: Motorcycle, tram 1, tram 2, truck
Motorcycle, truck, tram 2, tram 1
Tram 1, tram 2, motorcycle, truck.

questions.question: Do you have to give way to the gray car if it turns left?

options.text: Depends on the speed of the two vehicles
Yes
No

questions.question: What do you do in the present situation, if you are driving the green car?

options.text: Enter the intersection carefully and turn left only
Stop and do not enter the intersection
You may turn right only.

questions.question: What do you do when traveling on a public road and you meet the indicator ‘Priority over the opposite direction’?

options.text: Stop and give way to vehicles approaching from the opposite direction
Keep moving, because you have the right of way
Stop and grant the right of way to oversized vehicles approaching from the opposite direction.

questions.question: In this case do you have to grant the right of way to the car coming from the right?

options.text: Yes, because the right priority rule applies
Yes, because you are crossing a road with priority
No, because the color of the traffic light is green.

questions.question: Which vehicles crossing the intersection have the right of way?

options.text: Truck and car
Motorcycle and tram
Motorcycle and truck.

questions.question: At marked pedestrian crossings, without traffic lights, if the road has one lane and pedestrians are on the sidewalk near the road and intend to cross, you must:

options.text: Drive at a speed not exceeding 30 km/h in towns and 50 km/h outside
Reduce speed abruptly and give way to pedestrians, who have the right to cross
You have no obligation or legal liability in case of any accident.

questions.question: What obligations do you have if you are driving the blue car?

options.text: Continue moving in the forward direction, without any obligation
Give way to the red and green cars
Give way only to the green car.

questions.question: How will you proceed, when making a right or left turn you intersect a cyclist traveling on a designated bicycle lane?

options.text: Give way to the cyclist
Do not give way to the cyclist
Adjust your speed so that you will not intersect the cyclist.

questions.question: At a crossing, which one of the following signs grants vehicles the right of way:

options.text: Intersection with a road without priority
Straight ahead
Traffic in both directions.

questions.question: You approach a forest road and from the right side of the road a vehicle is leaving the forest. Who has to wait?

options.text: You, because you accord right priority
The vehicle leaving the forest
The vehicle traveling at a higher speed.

questions.question: Your vehicle is on an agricultural road and you intend to turn right, entering a main road. From the left, another vehicle is approaching. Who gives priority?

options.text: It is not allowed to enter the main road from an agricultural road
The vehicle that is traveling on the main road because you are on the right side
You.

questions.question: Which vehicle enters the intersection first?

options.text: The truck, because the car is turning left and intersecting its direction of travel
The car, as it comes from the right side of the truck
The truck, because it doesn’t change its direction of travel.

questions.question: In the first intersection:

options.text: You will give way to vehicles circulating from the right
You have the right of way
You will give the right of way to vehicles circulating from the left.

questions.question: The right of way is given in the following situation:

options.text: At the indicator “Priority for circulation from opposite direction”
At the indicator “Intersection with a road without priority"
At the indicator “End of priority road".

questions.question: In what sequence will the cars pass through the intersection with the yellow traffic lights flashing?

options.text: Red, green, blue
Red, blue, green
Green, blue, red.

questions.question: What is the order in which the vehicles pass through the intersection, if the lights are not working?

options.text: Tram 1, tram 2, car
Car, tram 1, tram 2
Tram 1, car, tram 2.

questions.question: How will you proceed in the intersection if you are driving on the priority road?

options.text: Give way to vehicles coming from the right
Give way to all passing vehicles
Do not give way to any vehicle and follow the traffic lights.

questions.question: Which of the vehicles must give way to pedestrians?

options.text: The vehicle you are driving
The vehicle that comes from the front
Both vehicles.

questions.question: How do you proceed correctly in this situation?

options.text: You cross in front of the taxi
You allow the taxi to pass
You only grant right priority.

questions.question: You turn left at the intersection. How should you proceed?

options.text: You give way to the vehicle on the left
You have priority over the black car on the left
You are not allowed to turn left.

questions.question: What do you do in this situation?

options.text: Continue driving at the same speed
Accelerate to move quickly over the crosswalk
Stop and give way to pedestrians.

questions.question: Which car is placed correctly to cross the intersection?

options.text: All cars
Green and red car
Blue and yellow car.

questions.question: What is the sequence in which the vehicles pass through the intersection?

options.text: Motorcycle, car, truck
Truck, car, motorcycle
Car, motorcycle, truck.

questions.question: Which of the three vehicles do not have priority to pass?

options.text: Car and bus
Bus and truck
Truck and car.

questions.question: What is the sequence to pass through the intersection, if all the vehicles reach at the same time?

options.text: Truck, tram, car
Car, truck, tram
Tram, car, truck.

questions.question: To steer left:

options.text: The cars will bypass each other from the left of the imaginary center, without intersecting their paths.
The red car will give way
The red car will pass behind the blue car.

questions.question: In this case:

options.text: You must give way to the truck
You are allowed to turn in front of the truck
You must allow only the car to pass.

questions.question: If, at an intersection, a vehicle meets a green traffic light and the indicator “Give Way”, the vehicle shall:

options.text: Respect the significance of the green signal
Respect the significance of the indicator
Respect the significance of the green signal, giving way to vehicles traveling on the priority road.

questions.question: At an undirected intersection between a country road and a local road, the right of way is granted to:

options.text: Vehicles that drive on the country road
Vehicles that drive on the local road
Vehicles coming from the right side.

questions.question: What are a driver’s obligations before entering the first street to the right, in a roundabout?

options.text: Bypass the roundabout and then steer to the right
Signal the intention to perform the maneuver, ensure, engage closer to the right edge, and then enter that street
Stop the vehicle, ensure and change direction to the right.

questions.question: To whom must you grant the right of way if you are driving the car blue?

options.text: The bus, because it is a public transport vehicle
The red car, as it does not change its direction of travel
Both vehicles.

questions.question: What should you keep in mind, if you intend to drive right after the car in front?

options.text: The pedestrians will you the right of way unconditionally
Give way to pedestrians, who are walking in your direction
Pedestrians are not allowed to cross this place.

questions.question: In what sequence will the cars pass through the intersection?

options.text: Blue, red, yellow
Red, blue, yellow
Yellow, red, blue.

questions.question: What do you do in this situation?

options.text: Grant the right of way to vehicles entering the intersection
Stop the vehicle
Drive at a speed slower than 30 km/h.

questions.question: What is the sequence in which the vehicles will cross the intersection?

options.text: Motorcycle, bicycle, car
Car, motorcycle, bicycle
Bicycle, car, motorcycle

questions.question: How does a driver move forward through an undirected intersection?

options.text: Reduce speed and give way to all vehicles
Reduce speed and give way to traffic coming from the right
Reduce speed and give way to vehicles traveling from the opposite direction and who change the direction of travel to the left.

questions.question: How will you proceed in the following intersection?

options.text: Give way only to traffic coming from the left
Give way only to traffic coming from the right
Give way to all those entitled.

questions.question: You intend to turn right. What do you do?

options.text: Pass in front of the pedestrians
Give way to pedestrians
Give way only to bicycles.

questions.question: What do you do in this situation, if you are driving the red car?

options.text: Negotiate the right of way with the other driver
Give way
Pass in front of the blue vehicle.

questions.question: In the proximity of a bus station with a bay, you are driving on the lane next to the border. What do you do when a public transport vehicle is signaling its departure from the station?

options.text: It is mandatory to stop
Reduce speed, and, if necessary, stop
Increase speed.

questions.question: In what sequence will the three vehicles pass through the intersection?

options.text: Bus, truck, car
Truck, bus, car
Car, bus, truck

questions.question: Which of the three vehicles will pass through the intersection first?

options.text: The tram, because it has the right of way
The yellow car, because it is changing the direction of travel
The red car, as it comes from the right of the other two vehicles.

questions.question: What obligations do you have at pedestrian crossings?

options.text: To drive at reduced speed in order to avoid pedestrians who are crossing
To reduce speed if pedestrians are crossing to avoid a possible accident
If pedestrians are crossing, to grant them the right of way.

questions.question: What is the sequence in which the vehicles cross the intersection?

options.text: Car, truck, motorcycle
Car, motorcycle, truck
Truck, car, motorcycle

questions.question: Which vehicle will pass through the intersection first?

options.text: Tram 1
Tram 2
Car.

questions.question: What will you do if you are in the red car and an official column is approaching?

options.text: Continue driving as you have the right of way in the roundabout
Stop and grant priority to the column
Turn right and leave the intersection

questions.question: You intend to turn right. What will you do with the pedestrians crossing the street correctly?

options.text: Turn without hesitation, because pedestrians are forced to wait
Give way to pedestrians, who are walking in your direction
Horn, so that the pedestrians allow you to pass.

questions.question: In what sequence will the vehicles pass through the intersection?

options.text: Car, truck, motorcycle
Truck, motorcycle, car
Truck, car, motorcycle.

questions.question: What should the driver of the green car do in this situation?

options.text: Overtake the bus from the right side after the red car has passed
Pass between the bus and the red car as it moves forward
Signal the bus to free the lane

questions.question: In this situation, do you have priority over oncoming vehicles?

options.text: No
Yes
The indicator means that traffic flows in both directions.

questions.question: Which of the three vehicles passes through the intersection last?

options.text: Motorcycle
Red car
Green car.

questions.question: What will you do in this situation, if the traffic lights do not work?

options.text: Grant the right of way to vehicles coming from the left
Grant the right of way to vehicles coming from the right
You have priority.

questions.question: What will you do in this situation?

options.text: Continue driving because you have the right of way.
Allow pedestrians to cross the street
Horn, for the pedestrians to stop, so you can move forward.

questions.question: What should you do if you drive straight and the traffic light has the yellow flashing light?

options.text: Stop, because the red light will appear next
Reduce speed and continue your way because you have priority
Always stop.

questions.question: What is the priority rule when crossing an undirected intersection between two roads of the same category?

options.text: Right priority
Priority to the one that has arrived first
Priority to the main road.

questions.question: Which vehicle will cross in the intersection first?

options.text: Car
Bike
Truck.

questions.question: Which vehicle will cross the intersection last?

options.text: Car
Bus
Truck.

questions.question: To which car must you grant the right of way?

options.text: No vehicle
Both vehicles
The car coming from the right.

questions.question: If you drive in a roundabout, you must give way to:

options.text: No vehicle
Vehicles about to enter the intersection
Buses and trolleybuses.

questions.question: In what sequence will the vehicles cross the intersection?

options.text: Blue, red, green
Blue, green, red
Red, blue, green.

questions.question: What are your obligations when a bus drives out of a station with a bay?

options.text: Drive with caution, but you have no obligation
Speed in front of the bus
Reduce speed, and, if necessary stop to allow the bus reenter traffic.

questions.question: In what sequence will vehicles pass through the intersection?

options.text: Car, truck, motorcycle
Truck, car, motorcycle
Car, motorcycle, truck

questions.question: What is the correct way to leave the priority road?

options.text: You have priority, because you are on a priority road
You give way to traffic coming from the front
You give way to traffic coming from the right.

questions.question: Which of the three vehicles will pass through the intersection second?

options.text: Green car
Red car
Truck.

questions.question: At a roundabout, drivers are prohibited to:

options.text: Reduce speed, because it may jam the traffic
Stop, except when traffic requirements are such
U-Turn, to bypass the roundabout.

questions.question: What vehicles have the right of way in the roundabout?

options.text: All vehicles in the roundabout, over those that are about to enter
All vehicles coming from front
All vehicles coming from the right.

questions.question: The driver while driving behind a bus, meets a “Stop” indicator, he must:

options.text: Continue driving behind the bus, because the bus driver has already stopped and ensured
Stop and ensure before crossing the intersection, even if this was done by the bus driver
) Continue crossing immediately after the bus, because, in this case there is no danger.

questions.question: What will you do if you are driving the car?

options.text: Give way to the tram
Give way to the bus
Give way to both, as they are public transport vehicles.

questions.question: Is the driver required to give way, when changing direction to the left, while the green signal is on?

options.text: No, because the green signal gives him priority
No, except when the oncoming vehicle is a public transport vehicle
Yes, to both, to vehicles coming from the opposite direction and pedestrians crossing the street the driver is about to enter.

questions.question: When two drivers approach an intersection simultaneously, who has the right of way in case one encounters the indicator “Stop "and other the indicator “give way“?

options.text: The driver that meets the indicator “Give way“
The driver circulating from the right
The driver that meets “Stop “indicator.

questions.question: What should you do, if you are driving the car?

options.text: Allow the truck to pass
Allow the tram to pass
Turn in front of the tram.

questions.question: Are there situations when the driver has to give way to a bicycle or an animal-drawn vehicle?

options.text: No, the legislation does not stipulate such situations
No, cars always have priority
Yes.

questions.question: At the undirected intersection of a county road and a village or local road, the right of way is granted to:

options.text: Vehicles moving on the county road
Vehicles driving on the local or village road
Traffic coming from the right.

questions.question: Cyclists and animal drawn vehicles are always required to give way?

options.text: Yes, because their speed is low
Yes, if they travel on county or village roads
No, if the road signs do not provide so.

questions.question: In what sequence will the four vehicles pass through the intersection?

options.text: Car, truck, motorcycle, bus
Bus, truck, motorcycle, car
Car, bus, motorcycle, truck.

questions.question: Which vehicle will pass through the intersection second?

options.text: Red car
Green car
Truck.

questions.question: What will you do in the first intersection?

options.text: Give way to all vehicles in the intersection
Give way only to vehicles that come from the left
Apply the right priority rule.

questions.question: Not granting priority means:

options.text: Not complying with road signals that oblige or warn
Non-compliance with signals at intersections
Forcing those who have right of way to modify their speed or direction or stop suddenly.

questions.question: In what sequence will the cars pass through the intersection?

options.text: Red, green, blue
Green, blue, red
Blue, green, red

questions.question: In this situation, you have to:

options.text: Stop, ensure and give way before crossing the intersection
You do not have any obligation, because you are on a priority road
Apply the right priority rule.
